snippet: What would happen if patients were encouraged not only to review their medical records but to really own them? A research collaboration called OpenNotes has set out to answer this question.
abstract: Dr Tom Delbanco, principal investigator of study published in journal Annals of Internal Medicine, reports on OpenNotes, a research collaboration that looked at patient and physician attitudes and reactions to creating medical records that patients could take home, study and own; while some concerns remain, overall findings are that open medical records can help patients make good decisions concerning their health between visits.
lead_paragraph: What would happen if patients were encouraged not only to review their medical records but to really own them? A research collaboration called OpenNotes has set out to answer this question.

headline.seo: A study encourages people to take the doctor’s notes home after exams.
headline.main: Project Puts Records in the Patients’ Hands
headline.print_headline: Project Puts Records in the Patients’ Hands
